questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Radial artery

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • The Radial artery is the preferred site for invasive blood pressure monitoring for several reasons:
  • • preferred site
  • • Accessibility : The radial artery is superficial and is easily accessible . This makes cannulation of the radial artery relatively straightforward . Collateral Blood Flow : The hand has a dual blood supply , with both the ulnar and radial arteries contributing. This means that if the radial artery becomes occluded, the hand still has a blood supply from the ulnar artery. Before cannulation , the Allen's test can be done to ensure good ulnar artery perfusion . Stable Signal : The radial artery provides a stable and clear pressure waveform , which is essential for accurate monitoring . Low Complication Rate : Complications such as infection , thrombosis, or embolism are relatively lower in the radial artery compared to other sites. Patient Comfort : The wrist's position can be more comfortable for the patient compared to other potential sites for arterial line placement. Easy to Dress and Monitor : Because of its location, the site is easier for healthcare providers to dress, monitor, and manage , reducing the risk of complications .
  • • Accessibility : The radial artery is superficial and is easily accessible . This makes cannulation of the radial artery relatively straightforward .
